meta.content: Flinthills USD 492 - USD 492 COVID-19 Continuous Learning Letter for Social Media

Students and Parents,
On Monday, March 30th, 2020 Flinthills USD 492 Middle and High Schools will begin the remainder of the school year under our new Continuous Learning Plan. As many of us are stressed during these transitional times we cannot express enough that your student’s teachers are also now working from home, also with no childcare and many with their own children navigating this new plan...

div.em: Current conditions as of 22 Apr 07:15 am CDT

div.div: Showers and thunderstorms, mainly after 9am. Some of the storms could produce heavy rainfall. High near 62. Northeast wind 9 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%.
A 50 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms before 1am. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. North wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 75. West northwest wind 7 to 10 mph becoming southwest in the afternoon.

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

div.h3: USD 492 COVID-19 Continuous Learning Letter for Social Media

span.span: On Monday, March 30th, 2020 Flinthills USD 492 Middle and High Schools will begin the remainder of the school year under our new Continuous Learning Plan. As many of us are stressed during these transitional times we cannot express enough that your student’s teachers are also now working from home, also with no childcare and many with their own children navigating this new plan themselves. We are all going to need flexibility from each other in order for this to work successfully. Below is a list of criteria the students are responsible for throughout the remainder of the year under the new Continuous Learning Plan.

span.b: On Friday, March 27th, 2020 beginning at 2:00 pm and running through 6:30 pm parents can ‘drive-through’ to pick up all the students’ personal belongings that were in their locker, as well as any textbooks or materials that they will need under the Continuous Learning Plan. For high school students, they should already have their laptop bag in their possession. If it was left in their locker over spring break, it will be returned along with their personal belongings in their lockers. For middle school students, each bag of their belongings will also include the students’ laptop and a charger. When middle school parents pick up their student’s belongings we will ask that parents sign a technology form stating that we are checking out the computer and charger to you.

Students are expected to log in to Google Classroom and attend a Zoom Conference Call at the beginning of every class daily in order for teachers to take attendance. This meeting will be brief and used mostly as a way for teachers to remain connected to their students. Teachers will be sending registration and access information out independently to all of their students and parents.
All Grades collected during the Continuous Learning Process will have full weights within Power School and all students are still expected to complete their coursework in a timely manner.

Student/Parent responsibilities for District Issued Technology will increase during these times as access to Mr. Casteel will be extremely limited. If you are having an issue with technology you must first seek assistance from the teacher of the course, during the office hours provided to parents by our individual staff members. If it cannot be figured out there, Mr. Casteel has established Technology Office Hours from 2:00-3:00 pm Monday thru Friday. Financial responsibility for mishandled, damaged and/or broken devices will be that of the student and parents.
